learning_objective: Justify the selection of specific control structures when tradeoffs involve implementation, readability, and program performance, and explain the benefits and drawbacks of choices made.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex enjoys lifelong learning and stays active by participating in physical activities and cooking. Alex wants to display their activities for the week using a program. The main structure of their program is given below: Based on the program flow, which of the following control structures selection will be beneficial and why?",
    "Answer1": "Use a Switch statement, because it can test for multiple conditions.",
    "Answer2": "Use a While loop, because it can continue to execute as long as the condition is true.",
    "Answer3": "Use a For loop, because it is convenient for iterating a pre-known number of times, like seven days a week.",
    "Answer4": "Use simple If-Else statements, because they can be used to test whether a condition is true or false.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "Given that Alex is planning their activities for a week (a fixed number of days), a For loop is most suitable because it is designed to iterate a known number of times. While loops and If-Else statements can be used, but they do not offer the same level of readability and ease of implementation for this specific use case. Switch statements are not necessarily applicable because Alex isn't testing multiple conditions.",
    "code_snippet": "integer days = 7\nfor every day in days\n    if day = 1\n        output \"Cooking\"\n    elseif day = 2\n        output \"Gym\"\n    else\n        output \"Reading\"\n    end\nend"
}
